pages.text: Unlike every other civilization, the Ancients understood and even embraced the Void upon discovering its true power.$(br2)When exposed to the Void, most materials disintegrate under the tension, but some bind even closer together. Both resources obtained from Purpur Remnants exhibit the latter.

Although quite damaged, our observations show that the Ancients mass-produced this material and used it for construction. After experimentation, we've found that the Void can mostly repair this chunk into a usable state. It does not appear to be noteworthy otherwise.

An unmistakable grime cakes the outer layers of this dust. Just like $(item)Remnant Chunks$(), it can be restored through the Void. The dust seems to be a fine mixture of the Ancients' building material and aged End Stone, which has us questioning why it is so useful.
